resources.string: Talk to {destinationName}
Investigate {POITags} for clues about Brother Umberto
Follow Brother Umberto's trail to {POITags}
Search for information about Umberto in {POITags}

string.comment: Yonas outside amrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_01
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_spreadarms001" />The Initiation of a new Soulwarden once called for a feast attended by the entire Order.

string.comment: Yonas outside amrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_01
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_explain" />But with just the two of us, I suspect it would make for a rather dull affair.

string.comment: I emphasized her I with *I*. What is our standard? Do we italicize? Please amend when you can
string.speaker: The Tempest
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: No! Why would you desecrate your body with a... hollow gem!? *I* ask no sacrifice of you. And yet... why?

string.comment: Yonas default
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" priority="high" />It is very hard to believe this dismal forest was once a happy place. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />So much that was good is gone.
Darkness in the Brightwood
Yonas recalls a priest named Brother Umberto who once ministered to the Soulwardens. The two of you decide to seek out Umberto in the town of Walsham in Brightwood and learn his fate.
"We need to recruit more Soulwardens."
<g id="female_nodyes" />Yes, we must find allies as well. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />We needn't repeat the failed experiment of doing this alone.
<g id="female_disappointed" priority="high" />Such fools we were, to turn away those who sought to support us.
"Why did you turn them away?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Arrogance… the childish notion we were special, <g id="male_willcoverit" />that we alone were destined to save the world.
<g id="male_think" bout="1.5"/>There was a priest who warned us, counseled humility… <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />but we refused his suggestions and his support.
"We could search for him now."

<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Hm. A suitable start, I suppose. Brother Umberto trudged off to Brightwood, as I recall. <g id="male_apologize" /> It's a dark and dead forest now, but perhaps he remains there.
<g id="male_gesturebackthere" priority="high" /> Meet me at the Shadowmine Shrine, and <g id="female_nodyes" />we'll go from there.
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" /> There is no more for us here. <g id="male_gesturebackthere" priority="high" />Meet me at the Shadowmine Shrine.

string.comment: Yonas south of walsham - talk-to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_gesturearoundroom" priority="high"/> I hoped time would bring new life to Brightwood, <g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />but it remains as dreary as it was two centuries ago.

string.comment: Yonas south of walsham - talk-to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The Order was long gone by the time the darkness descended here.
"What darkness? Corruption?"
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />No, it was the cold curse of the soulless Lost <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />that brought misery to Brightwood.
<g id="male_apologize" priority="high"/>If Umberto was even still here by that time, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />then he may well have departed.
"Where would he have gone?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />That, we must discover. I heard Umberto was ministering to the town of Walsham; <g id="female_gestureleft" />now but a haunted remnant of what it was then.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />I will leave the investigation to your youthful vigor and meet you north of town. <g id="male_bowShallow" />Good hunting, Warden.

Pastor Prewitt,

It is with the utmost urgency and discretion that I author this note. Out of respect for your seniority in Walsham, I choose not to challenge you publicly, but I am disappointed nonetheless.

These poor Lost souls who've wandered into town may seem to have lost their humanity, but is this not a test of our faith? The decision to bury them seems to me a decision to surrender hope; there simply must be a more humane way to handle this.

Please, let us at least discuss the matter.

Brother Umberto

Prewitt,

It is plain now that ignoring my concerns has cost this town dearly. Even the most faithful are on the verge of despair, and as we've seen, that seems to be the true source of this soulless plague. Our hollow prayers and efforts to bury these tragic events are only making matters worse.

I cannot bear to witness this tragedy unfold. I am told of a Faithful Knight who resides west in Ballard's Manor - Ser Galahad. I will seek him out, and if providence affords, I will return with the hope and the strength to save our town.

Brother Umberto
Meet Yonas near Walsham to begin searching for Brother Umberto
Search {POITags} for clues to Brother Umberto's whereabouts
Trace Brother Umberto's movements through the town
Collect the {itemName}s left behind by Brother Umberto
Locate the remnants of Brother Umberto's home
Read the lore page, "A Plea to Pastor Prewitt" to uncover what occurred in Walsham
Determine the fate of the town's residents in {POITags}
Read the gravestones in {POITags}
Wandered in soulless, name unknown, may the earth hide the horror
A scroll in his coat identified Majlad al-Nasir, but the man's soul is Lost
One of our own, Tova Sudeikin, alas, whether by despair or contagion, gone
Investigate Walsham Church for clues to the fates of Umberto and Prewitt
Defeat {targetName}
Read the lore page, "Seeking Salvation" to learn where Umberto went
<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />It appears the town fell to the Lost primarily from within, <g id="male_converseleft" />no signs of any defense.
<g id="male_think" />I wonder if Brother Umberto sought aid from somewhere else.
"He went west to seek Ser Galahad."
<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />Ser Galahad, eh? The shining knight from the court <g id="male_nodunderstand" />of King Artorius himself.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />An honorable warrior as I recall, but <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />a bit squeamish regarding the requirements of becoming a Soulwarden.

string.comment: Yonas north of walsham - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_02
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_converseright" />Many of the king's knights joined the Order… <g id="female_leanforwardSmall" />but of course, you know what happened to them.

string.comment: Yonas north of walsham - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_02
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_explain" />Galahad remained at Artorius's side, and now that I hear the name, <g id="male_nodUnderstand" />I do recall hearing he resurfaced after the war.
The Shining Knight

string.comment: TEMP - meet Galahad to the west, cinematic, check out Wraithsburg & Deggendorf, talk to Yonas, clear Ballards, meet in Brackwater
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: On the trail of Brother Umberto, you and Yonas have decided to head west, where the priest apparently went to request assistance from the knight, Ser Galahad.
"What happened to the king?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Hm. Some say King Artorius fell during the war, others say he fled, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />and there were even whispers that he turned.
<g id="female_youknow" />Perhaps Galahad can shed light on the fates of both the king and Brother Umberto.
"Let's head west then."
<g id="female_nodyes" />Yes, there are a few townships and manors that way, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />if they have not fallen Lost like Walsham.
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />You go on ahead - <g id="male_gesturebackthere" priority="high" />I want to do a little scouting to the north; it's time I pull my own weight. I'll catch up.
<g id="male_gestureRight" priority="high" />Go on your way then, young Soulwarden. I will be along soon enough.
Follow Umberto's trail west in search of the legendary knight, Ser Galahad
Read Galahad's Journal
I do not relish striking you down, my fellow Vigilant... but it is my duty.
May your soul find peace, brother.
Another who's not fallen is a welcome sight in these parts.
Come, warm yourself by my fire.

string.comment: Galahad Default
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="yonas_bowShallow" />Travel safely, friend. While in the Brightwood, I suggest you stay on the road and avoid traveling at night.

string.comment: Galahad 1st Meet - talk to before cinematic
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" />Be wary, traveler. A great tragedy has occurred here.<g id="yonas_gestureAround" priority="high"/> The good people who lived in these hills have fallen and turned into soulless Lost.

string.comment: Galahad 1st Meet - talk to before cinematic
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="g_yonas_waghanddisagree02" priority="high" />If you've come seeking family or an old friend, I fear <g id="yonas_nod" />your journey may be in vain.
"I'm looking for Brother Umberto."
<g id="yonas_nod" />Ah, then there <g id="yonas_spreadarms002" />may yet be hope! Brother Umberto is a brave soul - <g id="yonas_explain01" />he and I joined forces to defend these fair lands.

<g id="yonas_headshakeDisappointed" priority="high"/>Ah, but the story pains me to speak aloud. <g id="yonas_gestureLeft" priority="high" />It is better if you read the account in my journal, just there.

string.comment: default on journal step
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: Read the journal if you wish to hear my sad tale.

string.comment: Galahad 1st Meet - talk to after cinematic
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="yonas_headnodyes" />Yes, friend. You are now acquainted with <g id="yonas_shakeheadWorried" />my regretful decision to abandon Umberto and go on a fruitless quest to find the king.

string.comment: Galahad 1st Meet - talk to after cinematic
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="yonas_explain02" />My only desire now is to atone for my mistakes, but I am not sure where to begin.
"We could search for Umberto together."
<g id="yonas_nod" />Indeed. I would like nothing more than to find company <g id="yonas_gestureLeftM" />in this lamentable endeavor.
<g id="g_yonas_spreadarmsnod" />If you are willing to overlook my failed duties to the Vigil, <g id="yonas_handHeartLove" />then I will heartily accept your offer.
"Where do we search?"
<g id="yonas_gestureBehind" />It was among these townships and the nearby manor that Umberto and I founded the Vigil.
<g id="yonas_thinking" />I know the Manor well - I will search there for clues and you can search the towns. <g id="yonas_bowShallow" />May the Light be with us both.

Umberto's Journal - March 17th

A cold wind blows instead of spring, and the trees of Brightwood are dry and devoid of new growth. Poor Pastor Prewitt fell Lost along with the rest of Walsham and now the Lost are appearing here in Wolfsegg.

Since Galahad's departure, several knights have left the Vigil, and I have begun recruiting and training the local townsfolk as new Vigilants. They've taken to calling themselves 'shadow hunters', and I won't discourage it... anything that keeps them hopeful is welcome.

Umberto

string.comment:
Umberto's Journal - June 8th

It is the peak of summer, but it remains cold, and crops wither in the field. It seems every week, we awaken one morning to find another of the townsfolk has fallen Lost. 

Despite my misgivings, I have to come to accept the only solution it to bury them. Strange as it is to see graveyards on Aeternum, my greater concern is that they will soon be widespread.

Umberto
string.speaker: Brother Umberto
string.name: BrotherUmberto

resources.string:
Umberto's Journal - June 8th

It is the peak of summer, but it remains cold, and crops wither in the field. It seems every week, we awaken one morning to find another of the townsfolk has fallen Lost.

Despite my misgivings, I've come to accept the only solution is to bury them. Strange as it may be to see graveyards on Aeternum, my greater concern is that they will soon be widespread.

Umberto
Investigate {POITags} for signs of Brother Umberto
Search {POITags} for signs of Brother Umberto or the Bright Vigil
Read Umberto's journal entry, "A Grim Springtide"
Search {POITags} for evidence of the departed Knights
Read Umberto's journal entry, "Hopeless Summer"
Collect {itemName}s from {targetName} and containers in {POITags}
Ildaria Gonzales - her smile departed, and then her soul
Despairing his Lost family, Hideki Matsubara now joins them
De Salazars, husband and wife, lost faith, but not each other
Return to the road and speak with Yonas

string.comment: Yonas Brackwater south - talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_bowShallow" priority="high"/>Ah, it is good to see you, young Warden. <g id="male_apologizesmall" />I have bad news - I found a large force of Corrupted to the east.

string.comment: Yonas Brackwater south - talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Ser Galahad has informed me that Corruption has claimed <g id="female_gestureleft" priority="high" />the Manor as well.
"What about Brother Umberto?"
<g id="male_gesturebackthere" />Ser Galahad continues the search in a town just north - <g id="female_nodyes" />the bright knight refuses to believe the Corrupted have again become a greater threat.
<g id="male_pointBlame" />But you and I know better, and we cannot simply <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />walk away.
"Can we drive them back?"
<g id="male_nodUnderstand" />We must try. I hoped to find only simple pockets of the Corrupted, <g id="male_think" />but they appear to be consolidating.
<g id="male_gestureLeft" priority="high" />I suggest you enter the Manor and strike down the Corrupted Commander. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />It could buy us time.

string.comment: Yonas Brackwater south - after talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_nodyes" />If you can defeat their Commander, it will weaken the Corrupted's hold here.
Investigate the presence of Corrupted at {POITags}
Eliminate {targetName}
Enter the church and defeat {targetName}
Travel north to rendezvous with Ser Galahad
I do not understand why you reject Corruption. Is there... someone telling you to do this? Lying to you about... everything...?
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />I welcome your aid for Umberto's sake, but I did<g id="litearmor_shakehead" /> not realize you were a Soulwarden.

<g id="g_male_pointblame"/>During the Wars, your order insisted on the delusion that the Crimson Madness could not be defeated. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Your friend, Yonas, now claims it's returned.
"Didn't you see it yourself?"
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Yes, some Corrupted still linger, <g id="male_spreadarmscalm" />but I assure you, the Crimson Sorcerer is long gone.

<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />The old man won't hear it - he scouts ahead, <g id="female_gesturearoundroom" priority="high" />determined to prove there's an army of the possessed hiding somewhere in the forest.

string.comment: Galahad Brackwater north - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_03
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />What matters most, however, is that we're united in seeking Brother Umberto.

string.comment: Galahad Brackwater north - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_03
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_willcoverit" />To me, it's clear: the darkness consuming the Brightwood is the Lost. Umberto and I swore to fight it, and <g id="male_clenchfistright" />I will honor that oath.
Losing the Faith

string.comment: TEMP - check out Shield's and Staudt, meet at nearby shrine
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Investigate Staudt's Manor and Kalterstein Cemetery for more clues about Umberto and then meet Galahad and Yonas at the shrine to the north.
"Did you find any clues?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Nothing to explain how this entire region fell to the Lost… <g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />just horrific stories as so many succumbed to despair.
<g id="male_converseright" />There is evidence Umberto and the Vigil abandoned this place, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />but no indication where they went.
"We should keep searching."
<g id="female_nodyes" />Very well, I have a few more houses to search in Wolfsegg Village.

<g id="female_pointLeft" />The Vigilants were apparently burying Lost in a nearby graveyard. <g id="male_compliment" />You should check there, and then we'll rejoin the old man. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Hopefully, with answers.
Go on then. We both have a duty to perform.
Search for information about Umberto in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Read the notice Umberto posted, "Condemnation of the Staudt Family"
Explore {POITags} and search for any references to the keep, Caer Dun
Meet Yonas and Ser Galahad near Wolfbough Shrine

Condemnation of the Staudt Family

Let it be known that the Staudt Family committed crimes against the community by conspiring to hide the fact that certain members of the household had fallen Lost. Unsurprisingly, the plague spread, and we now commit the entire family to the earth. Let it be known that the Staudt family's keep at Caer Dun has been seized by the Bright Vigil.

Grand Vigilant Umberto
(This map shows the location of the Staudt family's keep, Caer Dun, located in northern Brightwood.)
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have arrived just in time, young Soulwarden. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I was becoming quite concerned.
<g id="male_nodProud" />Yes, the courageous soul we've both been waiting for. <g id="male_converseright" />Your friend Yonas is rather disturbed about the presence of the Corrupted in these parts.
<g id="male_noway" priority="high" />You are putting it mildly, ser knight. Seeing such numbers this far south is a sign all of Aeternum is in grave danger.
Perhaps, but at the<g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" /> present, I'm more concerned about tracking down Brother Umberto. <g id="g_yonas_shrug" />Seems he left here seeking some fortress.
"It's a keep known as Caer Dun."
<g id="g_yonas_nod" priority="high" />Yes… I remember the place.<g id="g_yonas_thinking" priority="high" /> The fortress of Caer Dun lies some distance from here, however. Why there, I wonder?

<g id="g_yonas_nod"/>I will go straightaway, <g id="g_yonas_shrugdontcare"/>and leave you to sort out truth and fiction with Yonas. <g id="yonas_noddingheadapproval" />Have no fear. If I find Umberto, you'll be the first to know.

string.comment: Temp line added if needed for multi-convo to function with walkaway
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_sighRelief" />Hm. I feel guilty saying it, but I am relieved to see the knight depart. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />He clings to his ignorance with unwavering assurance.
<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />The Corrupted are here in force, just as I suspected. <g id="male_gesturebackthere" />There is a ranger nearby who has confirmed it.

string.comment: Yonas Wolfbough shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_04
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_nodding" />The ranger already scouted the extent of the territory the Corrupted have claimed.

string.comment: Yonas Wolfbough shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_04
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_convince02" />She believes their only goal is to collect resources for their war machine, <g id="male_think" />but I suspect a more sinister purpose.
Crimson Menace

string.comment: TEMP - go to mines, stop corrupted from mining & refining pure azoth, meet in settlement
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Yonas has discovered that the Corrupted have claimed several resource locations in Brightwood, including a massive iron mine. You need to investigate if they have an ulterior motive in seizing the mine and then meet Yonas in the town of Calvary.
"What are the Corrupted after?"
<g id="female_handsforwardRequest" />That is what you must investigate. I suggest you start in the mine. <g id="female_nodyes" />It could very well be something buried here.
<g id="female_gestureLeftM" />Find out what the Corrupted are seeking, <g id="male_pointLeft" priority="high" />and then meet me in the town of Calvary to the east.
Go on. I will meet you in the town of Calvary.
Investigate the Corrupted operation at {POITags}
Investigate the reason behind the Corrupted occupation of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Investigate ore piles for clues
Sabotage the Corrupted Azoth mining operation at Corlew's Mine
Destroy the 3 elements of the Azoth Refinery
Destroy the 3 elements of the Azoth Extractor
Defeat {targetName}
Travel to the town of {POITags} and report to Yonas
Look for Yonas at the Vigil's Rest Inn in Calvary
Pure Azoth... Ahh... Does it not feel right? Take that morsel from me. In return, I only ask you consider the feast I am offering.

string.comment: The line that used to be here was not recorded. So this is a new one from Isabella, I think.
string.speaker: The Tempest
string.name: Isabella

resources.string: More lies hidden on the island. It will be mine, it is required for to help fulfill our destiny.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I was on the verge of going to search for you… to apologize. <g id="male_apologize" />I doubted both you and the old man, but I was wrong.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />On the way to Caer Dun, I witnessed firsthand the size and activity of the Corrupted forces here in the Brightwood.
"Then you'll help us fight them?"
<g id="male_whatwantfromme" />On that matter, I am as yet undecided. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Finding Umberto is still my first priority.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Caer Dun offered more questions than answers - <g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />something dark happened there and it now lies vacant, perhaps even cursed.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_05
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_gestureLeft" />I have been inquiring around town whether anyone here was a witness to the Vigil's fall.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_05
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_handsHipsConsider" >But when I saw Yonas, I knew it was <g id="female_nodyes" />my duty to make amends to you both.
The Gates of Great Cleave

string.comment: TEMP - Yonas went north, find him, save him from attack, explore Caer Dun, get loot for Grace
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Yonas is scouting out the Corrupted presence in Great Cleave where he has asked that you join him and formulate a strategy for driving the enemy out of Brightwood.
"Where is Yonas now?"
<g id="female_disappointed" priority="high" />The old man has more courage than good sense - <g id="female_whattheheck" />he's gone to ascertain whether the Corrupted have a presence in Great Cleave.
<g id="male_explain" />I urged him to wait, but he refused. I suggest you head north right away to ensure his safety.
"What will you do?"
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will continue to seek answers regarding Umberto and the Bright Vigil.
<g id="male_pointLeft" />Go on and assist the old man. If the Light is with me, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I will have answers by the time you return.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Be wary out there, my friend. It seems <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />nowhere outside these town walls is truly safe.
Search for Yonas near the Corrupted front at Great Cleave
Recover Yonas's Fishing Pole
Search the area for Yonas
Defend the crossroads\nwhile Yonas retreats
Follow Yonas west\ntowards Caer Dun

string.comment: Yonas Encounter bark
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: There are too many! We must retreat and find a secure position!

string.comment: Yonas Fort Shrine -talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_hopeless" />In my most dire estimations, <g Id="female_disappointed" priority="high"/>I could not have imagined how desperate the situation has become.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Shrine -talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />A few years ago, the Great Cleave was quiet, safe. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" bout="1.5"/>But now the Corrupted appear to have total dominion.
"What does that mean for us?"

<g id="female_leanpointconvince" bout+"1.5"/>It means the Corrupted have already conquered all the territory from here <g id="male_pointLeft" />to the Shattered Mountain. <g id="male_hopeless" />It means we're too late.
<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" />Any day now, their forces will sweep south and claim the rest of the island.
"We need to hold them here."
<g id="male_waghand01" priority="high"/>The walls of Calvary are no match for the might of the forces we've just seen.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I would suggest we lay claim to <g id="female_pointLeft" />this fort, but the place is clearly cursed.
"This must be Caer Dun."
<g id="male_think" />Hm. If there's a way to remove the curse from the fortress, it might help us<g id="female_lookleft" /> defend against the Corrupted.
<g id="male_explain" />But we will also need to recruit an army of new Soulwardens! <g id="male_pointLeft" />Search the fort and then meet me in Calvary.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Shrine - after talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_willcoverit" />I am going to focus every moment on recruiting new Soulwardens. One thing is certain - we cannot do this alone.
Investigate the fort of Caer Dun

string.comment: Grace Fort Interior - talk to
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: <g id="grace_spreadarms" />Well now, imagine finding the only other sane person on this island, <g id="grace_gesturel" />here in this accursed place!

string.comment: Grace Fort Interior - talk to
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: <g id="grace_secret" />I heard this "Bright Vigil" amassed quite a fortune before they up and vanished. <g id="grace_yes" />They left a stain of evil as well.
"So you think the fort is cursed?"
<g id="grace_laughcocky" priority="high"/>You joking? I already got quite an earful about the curse before I left Calvary.
<g id="grace_pointL" />People down there don't like to talk about the Bright Vigil, but with a couple of coins, <g id="grace_headnodyes" />I heard what I needed to hear.
"What did you learn?"
<g id="grace_crossarms" />Ah, if you want to share in the secrets, you'll need to contribute to the cause… you know that.
<g id="grace_shrugdontcare" />This place makes my skin crawl - <g id="grace_convince2" />if you'll gather up valuables the Vigil stashed here, I'll tell you everything I know.

string.comment: Grace Fort Interior - in progress
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: Go on now. I'd rather not linger in this place too long.
Search {POITags} for valuables, and return them to Grace

string.comment: Grace Fort Interior - after valuables
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: <g id="grace_excited2" />Now we're talking… I see you found some shinies. Don't forget - <g id="grace_takeItem5s" priority="high"/>all this is going toward buying a boat to get off this crazy rock.

string.comment: Grace Fort Interior - after valuables
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: <g id="grace_sympathy" />I suppose you're more interested in hearing about this curse, though, aren't you?
"What became of the Bright Vigil?"
<g id="grace_secret" />Well, the dark truth is those righteous bastards turned on each other, and then of course, <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />they all fell Lost.
<g id="grace_lean" />Mayor Pennyfather in Calvary - he knows more than he lets on. Lean on him a bit, and he'll cough it up.

string.comment: Grace default (after valuables)
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: I saw the old man poking around here. Whatever crusade you're involved in, I want no part of it.
Return to {POITags} to learn about Caer Dun
<g id="male_gesturebackthere" />I saw Yonas in the tavern - he's recruiting new Soulwardens and <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />entertaining some dream of claiming Caer Dun for the Order.
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Balmy as ever, but I'm glad he's back behind town walls. <g id="male_compliment" />Good work.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_06
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" priority="high"/>I'm afraid I haven't been quite so successful. The only thing I've learned is that Umberto hasn't been seen for years.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_06
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The people of Calvary are strangely quiet when the subject of the Bright Vigil comes up.
The Vigil’s Truth

string.comment: TEMP - Talk to Pennyfather, check out Sarmad, check out Cathedral, talk to pennyfather again, return to Galahad
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Galahad has reached an impasse in the investigation into what happened to Umberto and the Bright Vigil. It's decided that you will speak with Mayor Pennyfather and follow up on any hints he's willing to share.
"Have you asked Mayor Pennyfather?"
<g id="male_nodUnderstand" />I did speak with the Mayor… a bit nervous that one. <g id="male_think" />Are you suggesting he's hiding something from me?
<g id="male_dontknowS" />Hm, I suppose I'm not the best conversationalist. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Perhaps you should speak with him. Go on.
<g id="female_nodyes" />If you learn anything definitive about Umberto, make sure to let me know.

string.comment: Pennyfather Default
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_spreadarms" />Always a treat to see a new face in Calvary, but <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />I have no time to talk right now. It's quite taxing to run this town, you know.

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: God's ears! <g id="male_whattheheckbig" priority="high" />Tell me you're not here to talk about missing priests, cursed forts, or the damned Bright Vigil.

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_throwarmsFrustrated" />Will you people never stop? Why can't I get any peace?
"Because you're hiding something?"

<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />Preposterous! I've nothing to hide… <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I just don't recall all the gory details. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I was busy building this town when the Bright Vigil fell.
<g id="male_dismissGetLost1" priority="high" />Besides, dredging up such dark affairs serves no purpose. It's just… <g id="male_shrugBrief" />depressing!
"Is that how Brightwood was cursed?"
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Nonsense! The Lost plague began before the Vigil was even founded… <g id="male_nodunderstand" />they just made things worse.

But fine! <g id="male_sighAcceptnews" />If you'll leave me alone, I'll tell you - visit the <g id="male_pointLeft" />town of Morgenstadt - something happened there... <g id="male_shrugBrief" />or so I heard.

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - after talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />Now I've already told you more than I should have. Let me be!
Investigate {POITags} to learn what Mayor Pennyfather is hiding
Search for clues at the center of {POITags}
Read the notice posted by Grand Vigilant Umberto

Notice to the people of Morgenstadt!

By decree of Grand Vigilant Umberto, the following families will be relocated from the town to be sheltered in Sonnesbruck Cathedral:

-Wallace
-van Hoesem
-de Goyer
-Fujiwara
-Cao
-Kazakov
-Khalid
-de Soto
Study Grave Markers for clues to Townspeople's fate
For Ysabel Arias, whose soul faded along with her beauty
Rajesh Malhotra held too tightly to a family he left behind
Liang Ji was a hunter like no other, until their luck ran out
Etched into the gravestone reads: For Ysabel Arias, whose soul faded along with her beauty.
Writing is roughly chiseled into the gravestone: Rajesh Malhotra held too tightly to a family he left behind.
In a thinly carved script, the gravestone reads: Liang Ji was a hunter like no other, until their luck ran out.
Offer the mirror
Offer the doll
Offer the lucky charm
[You place an offering on the plate.]
[You place an offering on the plate, but it tumbles back into your hands.]
Search homes for mementos of the Lost
Lady's hand mirror
A child's straw doll
Hunter's lucky charm
Offer mementos to the proper gravestones
Read Umberto's Orders to the Inquisitors at the Cathedral

Moira,

Tell the families there's no time to collect valuables, that they can return for that later. Once they get to the cathedral, administer the draught and then commit their poor, sleeping souls to the earth. Let us pray this will prevent their dour dispositions from infecting the rest of the village.

 - Umberto

PS. Don't worry about Pennyfather - I've informed him of the consequences of interfering.
Follow the clues to discover the fate of those sent to {POITags}
Obtain the {itemName} from {targetName}
Return to {POITags} and confront Pennyfather

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - post cathedral talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_blameShort" />I see that look in your eye… whatever you found up there, <g id="male_whatwantfromme" />I had nothing to do with it!

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - post cathedral talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="male_crossarmsNo" />The atrocities Umberto and the Vigilants committed against those poor, innocent families… <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" priority="high"/>it's simply unthinkable.
"But you knew… and did nothing."
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Yes, I-I knew what they planned… <g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />but if I spoke out, Umberto said he'd bury me too!
<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />Every day, I live with the shame of my silence… and in the time since, <g id="female_sympathyHandsheart" />I promise, I've done all I can to remove the curse.
"What did you do about the curse?"
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />I… I recruited a specialist… Master Alchemist Sun Fuchun from Ebonscale Reach. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />It's all I can do.
<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />You should speak to her… I've done all I can and there's nothing more to say. <g id="female_lookDownGuilty" priority="high" />Leave me to my shame.

string.comment: Pennyfather Vigils Truth - After post cathedral talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="male_giveup" priority="high"/>If you wish to see me punished for my silence, I accept it. I have nothing to say in my defense.
<g id="male_bowShallow" />Greetings, young Warden. I understand <g id="male_complimentplayer" />you left town after speaking with Pennyfather.
<g id="male_worry_1" priority="high"/>I must ask - what did you learn? Is it true that the Vigil resorted to dark methods of battling the Lost menace?
"Yes, they buried people alive."
<g id="male_lookdownAshamed" priority="high"/>I-I cannot imagine Umberto committing such atrocities, and I am doubly shamed if they were carried out in the Vigil's name.
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />As unpleasant as it may be, <g id="male_willcoverit" />I must speak to Pennyfather and hear the truth of this firsthand.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99_MSQ_07
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_nodding" />I will go and speak to the Mayor myself. <g id="female_youknows" />In the meantime, it would seem there are still questions as to Umberto's ultimate fate.

string.comment: Galahad in town - bestowal - 99_MSQ_07
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_spreadarms" />Did Pennyfather give you any leads to follow? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Someone who may know more?
Betrayal at Brightrest

string.comment: TEMP - meet Sun Fuchun, go to brightrest cemetery, meet galahad at new east shrine, meet Sun at Alchemist's Shrine
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Mayor Tunstall Pennyfather admitted that he was aware of the Bright Vigil's atrocities and the curse that followed. After discussing with Galahad and the Master Alchemist Sun Fuchun, it becomes clear where the trail leads next.
"The Master Alchemist Sun Fuchun."
<g id="female_nodyes" />Very well, then I will leave you <g id="male_complimentplayer" />to follow the trail wherever it leads.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will attempt to learn more about Umberto's fall… <g id="male_think" />I've begun to wonder if he ever sought to find the source of the Lost plague.
"Where did it come from?"
<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" priority="high" />It first appeared in the eastern fens, and <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Umberto and I had discussed traveling there.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />If there are no other leads, I shall inquire about him in the fens myself. <g id="male_complimentplayer" /> After that, let's meet to share what we've learned.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />If everything Pennyfather says is true, Umberto has horrific crimes to answer for…Unless he too has fallen Lost.

string.comment: Sun default
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_clasphandsGratitude" />Even shrouded in darkness, there is beauty in Brightwood. <g id="male_agree1" />If you know where to find it.

string.comment: Sun Settlement - talk to before Brightrest
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />If the mayor sent you to nag me about his invitation to tea, please give him my regrets.

string.comment: Sun Settlement - talk to before Brightrest
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="male_wavehandPshaw" />I don't have the interest or the time for social engagements, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />especially when he requests I work alone and keep everything so secret.
"You're studying the curse?"
<g id="female_shocked" />He told you? Well then, a secret no more! <g id="female_nodyes" />So yes, I'm trying to restore the "bright" to Brightwood.
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Despite Pennyfather's hopes, restoring the entire forest is impossible, <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />but I might be able to heal some locations.
"What about Caer Dun?"
<g id="male_shocked" />That fort on the hill? The Bright Vigil <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />was up to some DARK deeds there.
Believe it or not, <g id="female_nodding" />I could cure that place… <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />but only if I had help getting proof the Vigil's leaders paid for their crimes.
"I can help."
<g id="female_laughMed" />See now, patience is rewarded. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I've dreamt of this moment, and I know what to do.
<g id="female_pointright" priority="high" />The last Vigilants fell at Brightrest Cemetery - if you'll recover their Sigils and <g id="male_agree1" />meet me at the Postrekhin Shrine, I'll explain.

string.comment: Sun Settlement - after talk to before Brightrest
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: I have my part in this as well. I'll explain after Brightrest.
Collect Sigils from Lost Vigilants at {POITags} as proof they paid for their crimes
Burn the Bright Vigil's unused caskets
Cleanse darkness of Vigil's atrocities
Defeat {targetName} and recover his Sigil
(Optional) Search for Vigilant's Sigil in the grave
Defeat Vigilant Moira
Read Vigilant Moira's letter, "Dissension in the Ranks"
Meet Ser Galahad at the Pennine Shrine near Weaver's Fen
Bring the Vigilants' Sigils to Sun Fuchun at the Postrehkin Shrine

string.comment: Galahad at East Shrine - talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Fortuitous timing, my friend. You catch me on the verge of <g id="male_pointleft" />traveling into Weaver's Fen to inquire about Umberto.

string.comment: Galahad at East Shrine - talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Pennyfather was adamant that I'd find answers there.
"I'm meeting Sun to the south."
<g id="male_agree1" />Of course. With so many leads to follow, it's good we can split up.

<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will not dally in the Fen; I will gather what information I can and then rejoin you and the alchemist. <g id="male_salutefisttochest" />Until then, Light be with you, friend.

string.comment: Galahad at East Shrine - after talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: I have not visited the Fen since the Wars of Crimson Madness. Those are not fond memories.

Goura,

Whatever Umberto says, you musn't believe him! Something in the Grand Vigilant changed after I expressed doubts about Sonnesbruck. He's been paranoid, keeping secrets, something about making a "Heartgem" to protect himself... like those mad Soulwardens.

I fear he's trying to turn us against each other. If we don't stay united, I worry we'll both end up like the others...

(Unsigned)

<g id="female_takeItem5s" priority="high"/>Ah, you got the Bright Sigils? Amazing. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />I can't express how good it feels to have an ally in this effort - <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />especially one who can fight!
<g id="male_think" />We'll need some token from the Grand Vigilant as well, but that can wait.

string.comment: Sun Alchemists Shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_08
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="male_handsHipsConsider"/>Removing the curse from Caer Dun will take more than just seeing the Vigil's crimes avenged. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />We'll need the healing power of the earth itself.

string.comment: TEMP - Get herb from outside cave, get root from inside cave, get water from azoth tree, cinematic
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Title

resources.string: The Azoth Tree

In order to cleanse the curse from Caer Dun, Sun Fuchun needs Sacred Waters collected from the Azoth Tree in the nearby grove, but it's necessary to acquire vessels from the Shamans in the neighboring caverns in order to extract the waters. After collecting the waters, rejoin Sun Fuchun.
"The Angry Earth?"
<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Yes, but I'm <g id="male_explain" />not so keen on that wording. The so-called "Angry Earth" evolved from a deep and primal power.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />They pose a grave threat to humanity, <g id="female_nodyes" />but their bond with the energy of Azoth is sacred.
"How do you know all this?"
<g id="male_willcoverit" />My fascination with plants and alchemy began in the Old World, <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />but here, it transformed into something more… metaphysical.
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />This is how I know that with the right components, <g id="male_pointLeft" />we can heal the fortress of Caer Dun.
"What components do we need?"
<g id="female_clasphandsRequest" />A nearby grove harbors a sacred Azoth Tree, tended by Angry Earth shamans.

<g id="male_compliment" />Venture into the shamans' subterranean lair to claim their vessels <g id="female_nodding" />and then use those to collect the Sacred Waters from the tree's roots. I'll wait here.
The tree is invested with vast power. Step lightly in the grove.
Obtain the vessel used by the Angry Earth in the {POITags}
Gather a {itemName} near the entrances to the cave
Defeat {targetName} in the cave to collect the {itemName}
Visit {POITags} to collect the Sacred Waters
Approach the well of the Azoth Tree
Collect pure Azoth water
Touch the Azoth Tree
Bring the filled Vessel to Sun Fuchun

string.comment: Sun talk to with azoth water
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />There is something… different about you, I think. You were <g id="male_think" />touched somehow by the Tree, weren't you?

string.comment: Sun talk to with azoth water
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_apologetic" priority="high" />Don't worry - I won't pry. We want to remove the curse from Caer Dun, and now we have the waters.
"What else do we need?"

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />All that remains is some token to prove the Grand Vigilant has also answered for his crimes. <g id="male_pointleft" priority="high" />I believe your friend Galahad knows where to find him.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will go on to Caer Dun and make preparations. <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />See you there, soon, I hope.

string.comment: Sun after talk to with azoth water
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Be careful. The Grand Vigilant is as dark as they come.
<g id="male_think" bout="1.5"/>The alchemist is clearly gifted in some vestal fashion - you've done <g id="male_nodunderstand" />well partnering with her.
<g id="male_apologize" />My tidings are less inspiring… no sign of "Grand Vigilant" Umberto in the Fen, <g id="male_spreadhands" />but a clue guided me to find him back here.

string.comment: Galahad at Alchemists Shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_09
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />After all we've learned, I presumed Umberto had long since fallen Lost. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />It would have been a just fate, but no.

string.comment: Galahad at Alchemists Shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_09
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />I confronted him myself, and to my horror, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />his humanity has somehow been preserved.

string.comment: TEMP - find keys to enter sanctum, defeat umberto, get heartgem
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Title

resources.string: Umberto’s Sentence
Galahad has tracked Umberto to Vigil's Stand and it's now time to confront the fallen priest, acquire his Heartgem and then rejoin Galahad at the Postrekhin Shrine.
"He forged himself a Heartgem."
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />Did he? I will refrain from commenting on that practice out of respect, <g id="female_nodyes" />but Umberto must be called to answer for his crimes.
<g id="male_compliment" />If the Heartgem protects him, it must be destroyed, <g id="male_willcoverit" />though I cannot be the one to do it.
"I'll do it. Tell me where he is."

<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />The wretch has been hiding out all this time, <g id="male_righthandAngry" />and when I accosted him, he sealed himself <g id="male_pointright" priority="high"/>inside the sanctum at Vigil's Stand.
<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />Break in there, defeat him, and take his Heartgem. <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />I will await your return. <g id="male_bowShallow" />Godspeed, my friend.
<g id="male_compliment" />You're a brave soul to undertake this endeavor. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Umberto has become a monster.
Hunt down Brother Umberto in {POITags}
Investigate the walled sanctum at the center of {POITags}
Search the nearby homes for keys to the sanctum door's locks
Unlock Sanctum Gate and Enter the Sanctum
Defeat {targetName} and retrieve {itemName}
I will not repent, nor will I fall… it is you whose soul will be forfeit!
The righteous will always return…
Return and report your success to Galahad
<g id="male_sighRelief" />It is done, then? The tragic tale of the once-brave Brother Umberto <g id="male_nodunderstand" />finally draws to a close.

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />I am grateful to you, my friend, for helping me atone for my part in all this. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />We will never know if I might've prevented these atrocities.
"Blaming yourself serves no one."
<g id="male_willcoverit" />You are kind to say so, and indeed, we must look forward, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />never back.

<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />Speaking of which, I gather you and Yonas now seek to remove the curse on Caer Dun and claim it for the Soulwardens… <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />I suppose that's fitting.

string.comment: Galahad at Alchemists Shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_10
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_apologize" />I… must apologize. I judged the Wardens unfairly, perhaps during the Crimson Madness, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but most certainly now.

string.comment: Galahad at Alchemists Shrine - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_10
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You've proven the order is honorable and strong. With the Corrupted returning, <g id="female_saluteFistchest" />I salute your courage in facing it.

string.comment: TEMP - go to Caer Dun, talk, enter Undercroft, kill Umberto, curse lifted, talk
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Title

resources.string: The Curse of Caer Dun
Working with Ser Galahad, you've defeated Grand Vigilant Umberto and taken his Heartgem. All that remains is to return to Caer Dun and follow Sun Fuchun's instructions for removing the curse.
"What will you do?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I will return to Calvary and seek other ways I can help restore the Brightwood.
<g id="male_realize" />Perhaps Pennyfather will have grown a spine by now. <g id="male_shrugBrief" />Either way, <g id="male_willcoverit" />I will find some way to serve.
"Why not help fight the Corrupted?"
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />I'm not sure I have it in me to face the Crimson menace once more - <g id="female_nodyes" />this business with Umberto has left me feeling my true age.
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />I will have to consider the offer carefully… and then <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />perhaps I shall join you at Caer Dun.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will give your offer due consideration, my friend. <g id="male_bowShallow" />Until then, good fortune to you at Caer Dun.
Bring Umberto's Heartgem to Sun Fuchun near Caer Dun
Enter the Undercroft to destroy the Heartgem
Place the Heartgem on the altar and destroy it
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy the Heartgem's final seal and release Brother Umberto's soul
Return to the surface with the news of Umberto's defeat
Ask Sun Fuchun if the curse is lifted

string.comment: Yonas Fort Entrance -talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_bowShallow" />Welcome back, Warden. <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />If I had known the difficulty in claiming the fortress, I might've thought twice.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Entrance -talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />However, I understand it was Umberto's actions that cursed these grounds, <g id="female_spreadarms" />and somehow he was the last one standing?
"He tried to forge a Heartgem."
<g id="male_think" />Hm. It seems his soul was tormented and perhaps that drove him to make poor decisions. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />This island eventually makes fools of us all.
Come though, <g id="female_pointleft" />speak with the young lady. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />She has made all kinds of preparations.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Entrance -after talk to
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: If this works, I think we'll have a fine fortress for the new Order.

string.comment: Sun talk to with Umberto Heartgem
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_chuckle" />You were just in time to interrupt Yonas sharing another tale of your exploits. <g id="female_fingerwagno" />Not that I wasn't enjoying them, of course.

string.comment: Sun talk to with Umberto Heartgem
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_youknow" />But I'm keen to take a shot at removing this curse! <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Assuming you have the "Heartgem," are you ready?
"Yes, just tell me what to do."

<g id="female_explainS" />Keep in mind, this isn't an exact science, but <g id="female_nodyes" />whatever bad deeds the Vigil performed here, <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />the worst of them were in the Undercroft.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />I've anointed the entrance with Pure Azoth Water and <g id="male_nodunderstand" />placed the Sigils.
"What about the Heartgem?"
<g id="female_headnodding" />Take Umberto's Heartgem into the Undercroft <g id="female_smackfist" />and destroy it.

<g id="male_willcoverit" />If what I'm hearing is true and it protects some part of the soul, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />you may face some resistance. Bottom line, <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />he must answer for what he did.

string.comment: Sun after talk to with Heartgem
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Whatever you have to face down there, I have no doubt you can handle it.
My soul will not be so easily vanquished…
I am… released.

string.comment: Sun Fort Entrance - talk to
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_lookaroundWonder" priority="high"/>I must admit, I really wasn't sure this would work, but look at this place!

string.comment: Sun Fort Entrance - talk to
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="male_complimentplayer" />I'd say it's as pristine as the day it was built. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />You and I make a good team.
"Indeed. You should stay."
<g id="female_chuckle" />Funny, Yonas said the same, and Galahad's on board. <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />So I think I might allow myself to go along with the flow.
<g id="female_crossarmssuspicious" />Speaking of, I didn't push you on this before, but something happened to you at the Azoth Tree, didn't it?
"I saw a woman with a purple eye."
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />I told you that tree had power, didn't I? <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Its wisdom is directing you, of course, telling you what to do next.
<g id="female_youknow" />I think Galahad mentioned a sorceress with a purple eye… maybe we need to find her? <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Ask him about it.
Caer Dun
Curse Lifted

string.comment: Sun Fort Entrance - after talk to
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />If I'm being honest, I'm a bit jealous of you getting a vision from the Azoth Tree.

string.comment: Grace Fort Main Hall - after quest - FINAL
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: Well now, we got a right crowd hanging about this place.

string.comment: Grace Fort Main Hall - after quest - FINAL
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: Don't get me wrong, I'm not here to stay, but I'm glad to think we've found a safe spot from all the evils lurking on this damned island.

string.comment: Galahad at Caer Dun - talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: I've given the matter some thought, and I decided to take you up on your offer.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You've done well, young one. <g id="female_pointRight" />As menacing as that Corrupted army in Great Cleave may be, <g id="female_nodyes" />I believe we are safe here.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I will maintain my focus on recruiting and training new Soulwardens to defend the place.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Main Hall - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_11
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="female_gestureforward02" />You, on the other hand, have no such luxury. <g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />You've been quiet, but I can tell the voice of the Tempest still speaks to you.

string.comment: Yonas Fort Main Hall - bestowal - 99B_MSQ_11
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: <g id="male_concernS" />You are connected through the Pure Azoth you were exposed to, and <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Corruption's drive to claim it.

string.comment: TEMP - talk to Pennyfather, cinematic, meet Galahad at east shrine
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Title

resources.string: The Corpse Crone

Following the vision you received from the Azoth Tree, you've decided to search for the sorceress with the purple eye. You must revisit Mayor Tunstall Pennyfather in Calvary and then meet Galahad on the road to Weaver's Fen.
"What does that mean?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />It means you have been imbued with a power that exceeds my understanding, <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />and it makes you both a target and a threat to the enemy.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I do not envy the destiny that lies before you, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />nor do I know where it leads.
"What do I do next?"
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I will not pretend to understand such things as the Azoth Tree, <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />but neither will I deny its primal power.
<g id="female_nodyes" />You should heed the vision as Sun suggested. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Ask Galahad about this mysterious sorceress with the purple eye.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I believe in you, and if you need me, I will be here.
Go to {POITags} and ask Pennyfather about the Corpse Crone
Read the nearby "History of Brightwatch"
Meet Galahad near the Pennine Shrine

string.comment: Galahad at Caer Dun - after talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_spreadarms" />It seems providence has already seen fit to verify I made the right choice in coming.

string.comment: Galahad at Caer Dun - after talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I hear this talk of the sorceress with the purple eye, and <g id="female_nodding" />I believe we have another quest to undertake together.
"You know of the sorceress?"
<g id="male_agree1" />Yes, though I know her by another name, the Corpse Crone of Weaver's Fen. I have doubts about her existence.
<g id="female_gestureLeft" priority="high"/>But Mayor Pennyfather in Calvary is obsessed; go and hear his account and then <g id="male_nodunderstand" />meet me on the road to the Fen.

string.comment: Sun Fort Entrance - Talk to during Crone
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: SunFuchun

resources.string: I will stay here and help Yonas. I think he needs it.

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone - talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="male_whatwantfromme" />You again? No, please! I have nothing more to confess! You've already exposed my secret shame!

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone - talk to
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />And I understand you managed to lure Sun away on some crazy enterprise. What more can you take from me?
"Who is the Corpse Crone?"
<g id="female_shocked" />The Corpse Crone!? Don't say that name so loudly lest she be summoned! She is the true cause of ALL this darkness in Brightwood.
<g id="female_headnodding" />Indeed, I have written an account, just there. Read it for yourself, and know the horrors she wrought.

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone - talk to after history
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: Go on, read the book, though it might give you a fright!

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone - talk to after history
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />There now, you know the full story! Whatever terrible deeds you attribute to the Bright Vigil, they were victims too.

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone - talk to after history
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: <g id="male_concernS" />Tell me though - do you mean to track down the vile crone and hold her to account?
"I plan to seek her out, at least."
<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" />Be wary then, nosy traveler! Weaver's Fen is a foul territory, ridden with sickness and despair, all the crone's doing, no doubt!
<g id="male_chuckle" />I wish you luck though, or perhaps a miracle… you'll need it, I fear.

string.comment: Pennyfather Corpse Crone- after talk to - FINAL
string.speaker: Tunstall Pennyfather
string.name: HeadClericPennyfather

resources.string: I thought you were going to Weaver's Fen… good riddance, I say!

string.comment: Yonas Fort Main Hall - after quest - FINAL
string.speaker: Yonas Alazar
string.name: YonasAlazar

resources.string: More and more brave young souls join our ranks each day.We may yet return to the numbers we had so long ago.
<g id="male_sighRelief" />You've heard Pennyfather's sordid tale, have you? I do not give that man's story much credence.
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Neither do I have any desire to meet this sorceress… such types cannot be trusted, in my experience.

string.comment: Galahad at East Shrine - lead-in for WF MSQ
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: We were so naïve when we arrived on these shores.We actually believed this accursed island held the promise of Avalon.

string.comment: Galahad at Wolfbough Shrine talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: Glad you're here - the old man seems quite disturbed, but your presence will reassure him.

string.comment: Galahad at Wolfbough Shrine talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: In regards to Umberto, I found references to the Bright Vigil relocating to a more defensible location. I might even know where.
"It's a keep known as Caer Dun."
Ah, then my suspicions were correct. The fortress of Caer Dun lies some distance from here, however.
I will go straightaway, and I will leave you to sort out the truth and the fiction with Yonas. We'll meet again, soon.

string.comment: Galahad at Wolfbough Shrine after talk to
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: Have no fear. If I find Umberto, you will be first to know.
I feel guilty saying it, but I am relieved to see the knight depart. He clings to his ignorance with unwavering assurance.
The Corrupted are here in force, just as I suspected. This level-headed ranger has confirmed it.
